topics.body:
I gave up on torrenting Ultraman nexus. (At that rate it would have taken a month to download the series.)

Now the question is, How do I watch Nexus?

Edit: Tried [Ultraman nexus]'s subs and they're working out much better. (I probably should have gone with them in the first place anyway, Since while they don't translate the OP and ED themes, At least they aren't TV-Nihon.)

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551efffa63687248542e0400#post_551efffa63687248542e0400
[bq]The main vocals of the song are provided by Emerson, whose high-pitched, operatic rapping features both references to Wittgenstein and casual swearing. Emerson's rap is largely cowboy-themed.

In addition to the rapping, a children's choir sings about various holidays (Christmas, Yom Kippur, Ramadan and Labor Day, among others), ending each verse with the line "Do all your shopping at Wal-Mart!"

Near the end of the song, Mankin shouts political phrases through a bullhorn.[/bq]

topics.body:
Random life post:
Christ; no wonder why transitioning costs so much money or time.

I always thought permanent hair removal costed a lot of money for a professional to do it when in reality you can just buy the laser for home use, but when you break it down it's not that much.  2 to 3 hours for your entire body and twice a week for 3 to six months; then waxing your face to use the hair removal crÃ¨me and applying it 3 times a day for four days after each time you wax and doing laser on top of that; then working out for a hour and a half 3 times a week to reduce your stomach and increase your butt; then breast pumps and hormones on your chest; and don't forget working on your voice as well a hour a day for 3 to 6 months.

I'm going to wait a month to do the exercises and my voice cause I'm almost done with my body hair removal, just have to do weekly touch-ups from may forth, and I won't have 5-6 hours a day to work on this soon so I'll have to break it up into parts so it's much more manageable.

It sounds random but the psychologists' standard for whether or not they'll give you hormones is complete bullcrap because you have to live as a woman for six months before they give you hormones and therefore you personally have to drop 1000 hours on transitioning *BEFORE* you officially transition when hormones could slash that in half and save the person easily 500 hours and make it easier for them.  You either have to go the "holy fuck!  How much money do you have?!" route or the "holy fuck!  How much free time do you have?!" route cause there is no middle ground.  No wonder why the majority of transgender people illegally buy hormones because that's complete bullcrap that they won't even consider you for hormones until six months to a year after you've already began transitioning.

topics.body:
As strange as it sounds, and even though it's personal, I'm having to cut out anime and video games for the time being so I have enough time to continue transitioning and have adequate free time.

Tl:dr of my past two posts;
I have to choose between two of these four and *ONLY* two:
A)Video games
B)Anime/Manga
C)Free time
D)Transitioning


Inb4 someone complains that I'm not cancelling transitioning so that I can read their favorite manga/watch their favorite anime.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551f0b8763687263b75f0a00#post_551f0b8763687263b75f0a00
I'm not completely giving up games, but I'll have to play them over a much longer time scale; instead of completing a game a week I'll have to complete one game a month instead.

April I have Dead Space 2 scheduled; May is Devil May Cry 4; June is Borderlands and hopefully by then it'll be the next steam sale.  Before someone suggests games for the next steam sale I already have 3 picked out.
